content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
──────────────────────
No new structures have been successfully placed. Repeated efforts to establish a Lab at (0.5, 2.5) for supplying Automation Science Packs have not resulted in a constructed facility—the lab placement and crafting attempts failed due to inventory shortages and unmet ingredient requirements. Although retrieval calls identified furnaces (an alternative furnace at Position(x=5.0, y=5.0) and a copper furnace at Position(x=-27.0, y=-60.0)) for smelting purposes, these were not built by the agent; rather, they were referenced from pre‐existing assets and did not result in any newly created production structures.

ERROR TIPS
──────────
• API Call Issues with get_entities  
 – Use the function’s exact signature. Do not pass unsupported keyword arguments like ‘radius’ or extra positional arguments.  

• Lab Placement and Inventory Validation  
 – Verify that the required Lab is present in inventory before attempting placement.  
 – Ensure that retrieval methods yield valid (non‐None) lists to avoid iteration errors.

• Crafting Dependency Shortfalls  
 – Confirm that all sub‐ingredients (such as iron-gear-wheels, copper-cables, and electronic-circuits) are available prior to initiating Lab crafting.  
 – Establish complete resource and production chains (including sufficient iron-plates and copper-plates) to meet recipe requirements.

• Handling NoneType Results  
 – Check API call outputs for None before iteration to prevent TypeErrors and implement fallback mechanisms as needed.
